intro: Nageia motleyi, commonly known as the Motley's nageia, is a rare conifer native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its needle-like leaves and cone-bearing structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. Its botanical features include a slender trunk and a dense crown of foliage. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
